channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Multiple pot holes between car park and the Stables, 5th February
item.description:
There are multiple potholes on a 20m stretch of daisybank road between the following locations ///supporter.zaps.equality And ///expose.chaos.posed I hope itâ€™s ok to report these (about 10 in total) rather than report separately. They are very close to 75mm deep so need addressing. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Daisybank Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement has worn away and is now a hole and a muddy mess, 5th February
item.description:
Outside 289 Gloucester Road. Been getting progressively worse for a couple of years. Mainly due to people pulling up and parking to avoid the bus stop when delivering parcels etc.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 287a, Gloucester Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Light not working, 5th February
item.description:
Parkland road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Parkland Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Marking missing across drive, 5th February
item.description:
Outside number 8 & 10 Kingsmead Road, both pavements are lowered for our driveways, but we keep getting people (Baylis workers) parking across our drives for the majority of the day. There is no marking on the road not to park there, just the lowered pavements. Please can a white line be painted across our driveways to hopefully prevent this happening in the future

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Kingsmead Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.description:
Objects dumped in lake. Danger to swans and other wildlife

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Monica Drive, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Blocking visibility on road/junction (Grass/verge) problem, 5th February
item.description:
cars parking on verges causing damage and massive muddy sections on footpath where children walk to school
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Danger, 5th February
item.description:
Photos were taken today 5th February, 3 minutes before children leave High School Leckhampton! No footpath access at all! The lorry has been causing the obstruction since 14.45! Action needs to be taken against Miller Homes (the developers).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement
